thread.title: If you live here, shut your windows
thread.title_full: If you live here, shut your windows

title: If you live here, shut your windows
text:
Grass fire at Boondall prompts warning for five suburbs Chris Honnery, The Courier-Mail February 8, 2017 9:12am 
BRISBANE residents may be affected by smoke which is currently billowing from a grass fire in the city‚Äôs east. 
Queensland Fire and Emergency Services crews are on scene at the fire burning around the Boondall Wetlands and Nudgee Beach area. 
It is understood to pose no threat to homes but authorities warned it is generating a lot of smoke in the area. 
Residents in Nudgee, Boondall, Bracken Ridge, Shorncliffe and Sandgate are being told to keep windows and doors closed today. 
Motorists may also be affected by decreased visibility due to the smoke. Large fire at Nudgee Bch blowing smoke over the Gateway at Boondall #chopperview @QldFES üî•üí® üöÅ pic.twitter.com/nYtszQ0T1C
